data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3572057,"name":"Ryan zheng","username":"Rzheng1232","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rzheng1232/{size}/182897_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-29T04:18:52.932Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eHey guys,\u003cbr\u003e\nI’m trying to utilize mt2 for global robot pose estimation in tandem with the swerve drive’s encoder and gyro values. Currently I’m having issues where being the poses on the red alliance side of the field aren’t properly being mirrored (\u003ca href=\"https://youtube.com/shorts/sn_eH9D7noA?si=okwrSUhCEfO545gx\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003evideo\u003c/a\u003e). I tried adding 180 degrees to the gyro angle when on the red alliance, but that just causes the robot to completely disappear from the field, although I’m not sure if I’m adding 180 in the right place in the code. (\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/Happyjog/3984-Reefscape-v1/blob/spittertemp/Reefscape/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/Swerve.java\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003eMy code\u003c/a\u003e This has been really confusing for me and I would appreciate to hear how other teams are handling the field mirroring.  Also, our robot has a button on the driver controller that resets the gyro orientation to 0; Would this interfere with the mt2 pose estimation if it was used in the middle of the match?
